cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing NNW this morning, then turning north and NNE while paralleling the Texas coast; expected to come ashore along the central Texas coast Monday afternoon-evening and track toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near/just north of Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Port Aransas to Freeport, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coastline from the Rio Grande through the upper Texas coast and into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief gusts to near hurricane force possible if Nicholas strengthens just before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in the San Luis Pass–Freeport area, producing minor coastal flooding at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, creating a high threat of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, and short-fused river/stream rises that could disrupt port operations.
